item.title: EU rules to force USB-C chargers for all phones
item.description: Manufacturers could be forced to change devices to a uniform charging system.

item.title: Apple bans Fortnite from App Store during Epic Games legal battle
item.description: The game won't be available on iPhones or other Apple devices until its legal battle with Epic Games ends.

item.title: AI cannot be the inventor of a patent, appeals court rules
item.description: "Only a person can have rights. A machine cannot," one of the judges wrote.

item.title: Apple threatened Facebook ban over slavery posts on Instagram
item.description: The media giant warned it would take Facebook products out of its App Store.

item.title: Extremists using video-game chats to spread hate
item.description: Campaigners say including extremist narratives among everyday conversations can be a pathway to radicalisation.

item.title: 'Side-eyeing Chloe' Clem to sell iconic meme as NFT
item.description: The image of Chloe Clem could fetch her tens of thousands of dollars at auction.

item.title: Lithuania urges people to throw away Chinese phones
item.description: The country's National Cyber Security Centre found security risks in both Xiaomi and Huawei models.

item.title: Vauxhall Motors plans Luton job losses amid chip crisis
item.description: The Unite union says it will "do everything in our power to mitigate or prevent" job losses.

item.title: NFT-based fantasy football card firm raises $680m
item.description: But some fans question if crypto-assets and football are a good mix.

item.title: Bitcoin mining producing tonnes of waste
item.description: Waste from the cryptocurrency process is similar to that from IT equipment somewhere like the Netherlands.

item.title: China: Children given daily time limit on Douyin - its version of TikTok
item.description: Douyin users aged under 14 will be limited to 40 minutes a day on the platform.

item.title: High-speed internet via airborne beams of light
item.description: The project has been developed by Alphabet's moonshot factory, X.

item.title: The AI body scanner detecting skin cancer and other news
item.description: BBC Click's LJ Rich looks at the best tech news stories of the week.

item.title: Why Icelandâ€™s volcanoes may aid future Mars exploration
item.description: Scientists are using the country to test drone tech that could one day explore the planet's terrain.

item.title: The world's most powerful magnetic field and other news
item.description: BBC Click's LJ Rich looks at some of the week's best technology stories.

item.title: Is this the era of a more shopping focused social media?
item.description: Virtual retail is changing and becoming more embedded in our day to day online activities.

item.title: Esports: Why are there so few professional women gamers?
item.description: There are no female players in the top 300 earners in esports, according to research shared with BBC News.

item.title: How 'nerd' culture powered through the pandemic
item.description: Meet the online content creators beating the odds to build successful careers from their passions.

item.title: Can apps manage our chronic health conditions?
item.description: A Swedish tech firm has created an app to help alleviate people's joint pain.

item.title: Should schools retain online parents' evenings?
item.description: Parents and teachers seem to agree it is the number one innovation worth keeping post-lockdown.

item.title: The big problem of building waste and how to tackle it
item.description: How better technology and regulation could cut the waste generated by the construction industry.

item.title: Sir Clive Sinclair: Tireless inventor ahead of his time
item.description: The prolific innovator invented the pocket calculator and the ill-fated Sinclair C5 electric car.

item.title: Why even giant ships can't solve the shipping crisis
item.description: A shortage of vessels is hampering global trade and may lead to empty shelves before Christmas.

item.title: Jesse Lingard takes control of a Rainbow Six Siege esports team
item.description: The footballer believes his experiences on the pitch will translate to the online world.

item.title: The pressures - and rewards - of being an influencer
item.description: Running your own popular YouTube channel can be lucrative, but it comes with downsides.

item.title: Could a reboot make social media a nicer place?
item.description: A Harvard University project will explore whether social media can be de-toxed
